head.title: June 18-24; To Deal or Not to Deal

hedline.hl1: June 18-24; To Deal or Not to Deal

block.p: With six months left in office and frustrated by the ability of Slobodan Milosevic to keep his job, the Clinton administration is exploring with America's allies suggestions that Yugoslavia's president might leave office if he were given guarantees for his safety and savings, despite his indictment on charges of war crimes in Kosovo. Greece is doing the intermediary work. American spokesmen denied any thought of a bargain, but senior American and NATO officials said differently.

With six months left in office and frustrated by the ability of Slobodan Milosevic to keep his job, the Clinton administration is exploring with America's allies suggestions that Yugoslavia's president might leave office if he were given guarantees for his safety and savings, despite his indictment on charges of war crimes in Kosovo. Greece is doing the intermediary work. American spokesmen denied any thought of a bargain, but senior American and NATO officials said differently.
